net.realmproject.dcm.event

Class IDeviceEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.realmproject.dcm.event.IDeviceEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, DeviceEvent

    public class IDeviceEvent
extends java.lang.Object
implements DeviceEvent
    A DeviceEvent consists of an id representing the device of publication, a type representing the intent of the message, and an optional Serializable payload.

    DeviceEvents also have timestamp and zone properties. The zone property is an arbitrary string representing what part of a larger network of devices the event originated from, and is usually not set by the publishing device, but by a component like a DeviceEventBus
    Author:
    chabotd, NAS
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getTimestamp

        public long getTimestamp()
        Description copied from interface: DeviceEvent
        Gets the time that this event was published (according to the computer which published it). The time is represented as a unix epoch time with millisecond precision as returned by System.currentTimeMillis(). By default, this timestamp is set to the time DeviceEvent was created
        Specified by:

      • isPrivate

        public boolean isPrivate()
        Description copied from interface: DeviceEvent
        Private events are events which are not meant to be propagated beyond the zone they were emitted in. DeviceEventBus implementations should not broadcast private events from other zones.
        Specified by:
        isPrivate in interface DeviceEvent
        Returns:
        true if this event is private, false otherwise.
